overview.content: Adipose tissue is rich in mesenchymal stem cells, growth factors, and cushioning matrix. We harvest a small amount via mini-liposuction, process it in a closed system to preserve cell integrity, and reinject it into joints or tendons under ultrasound guidance. The cells modulate inflammation, improve lubrication, and stimulate repair for long-term relief.

seo.metaTitle: Adipose Cell Therapy London | Micro-Fragmented Fat Injections | Dr. SNA Clinic
seo.metaDescription: Regenerative adipose cell therapy in London. Autologous micro-fragmented fat injections cushion arthritic knees, hips, and ankles with long-lasting relief.

schema.howPerformed: This two-part procedure happens in our clinic theatre: (1) Mini-liposuction—under local anesthetic (with optional light sedation), we extract 10-20ml of fat from your abdomen or thigh using a tiny cannula through a 3mm incision; (2) Processing—your fat is immediately processed in a closed sterile system that mechanically breaks it into micro-fragments, preserving precious mesenchymal stem cells, growth factors, and cushioning matrix; (3) Injection—using live ultrasound or fluoroscopy guidance, we inject the golden micro-fragmented fat directly into your damaged joint. The whole process takes 90 minutes
schema.preparation: Fast for 4 hours before (clear fluids okay). Stop blood-thinning medications one week prior if safe. Bring loose, comfortable clothing. Someone must drive you home if sedation is used. Complete any required imaging (MRI/X-ray) beforehand. Eat well in days leading up—healthy fat makes healthier cells. Come ready for significant, long-lasting relief
schema.followup: Rest treated joint for 48-72 hours—gentle walking okay, but no high-impact activities. Use ice packs and prescribed pain relief. Small liposuction site needs simple dressing changes. Avoid anti-inflammatories for 2 weeks as they interfere with healing. Follow prescribed physiotherapy protocol to guide new tissue formation. Most people return to desk work in 2-3 days, physical activities after 2 weeks
schema.outcome: Over 6-12 weeks, joint pain steadily decreases as inflammation calms and tissue regenerates. Joints feel more cushioned and stable. Mobility improves. Many patients significantly reduce or eliminate pain medications. The stem cells and growth factors create lasting repair—not just symptom masking. Results typically last 24+ months. You can repeat treatment to maintain gains or treat additional joints
schema.medicationRequired: Local anesthetic for liposuction and joint injection. Optional light sedation (oral or IV) for anxious patients
schema.treatmentFrequency: Single treatment session. Many patients achieve lasting relief for 24+ months. Can repeat as needed or add PRP boosters for enhanced results
schema.adverseOutcome: Bruising and tenderness at liposuction site for 5-7 days. Joint soreness for 48-72 hours (like a deep bruise). Small scar at liposuction entry point (fades significantly). Very rarely: infection (we use strict sterile technique) or treatment site swelling requiring drainage
contraindication: Taking blood thinners (warfin) without medical clearance

longDescription: Adipose cell therapy uses a small sample of your own fat, processed in clinic to extract regenerative cells and cushioning matrix. Injected into painful joints, it reduces inflammation, improves lubrication, and protects cartilage for sustained relief. It’s ideal for patients who want a potent, natural alternative before considering surgery.

faq.answer: Only a tiny 3mm puncture site that fades significantly over time. We use hidden entry points (abdomen or thigh) where possible. Most patients find scars virtually invisible after a few months.
faq.question: Does adipose harvest leave scars?
Can I drive home after adipose therapy?
faq.answer: If no sedation is used, yes. If you opt for sedation, you'll need someone to drive you home. Most patients are comfortable leaving within an hour of the procedure.

faq.question: How much does adipose cell therapy cost?
faq.answer: Adipose cell therapy starts from £2,250. The Adipose + PRP Booster package is £2,950 (save £300). Elite Cellular Recovery is £3,450. Consultation fee (£150) is credited toward treatment. 0% finance available.

faq.question: How long do adipose therapy results last?
faq.answer: Results typically last 24 months or longer. The stem cells and matrix integrate into the joint for sustained cushioning and repair. Many patients experience relief well beyond the 2-year mark.

faq.question: Does the adipose procedure hurt?
faq.answer: We use local anaesthetic for both the liposuction harvest and joint injection. Most patients feel only mild pressure. Optional light sedation is available for anxious patients.

faq.question: Is adipose therapy better than PRP for joints?
faq.answer: Adipose therapy is more potent than PRP alone, delivering stem cells plus cushioning matrix. It's ideal for moderate to severe arthritis or when PRP hasn't provided sufficient relief. Many patients combine both for enhanced results.

faq.question: Can adipose therapy help me avoid joint replacement?
faq.answer: In many cases, yes. Adipose cell therapy can regenerate cartilage, reduce inflammation, and provide long-term cushioning that delays or avoids surgery. Dr Abbas will assess your imaging and give honest expectations.

faq.question: How many adipose treatments will I need?
faq.answer: Most patients achieve excellent results with a single adipose session. Optional PRP boosters at weeks 4-6 can enhance results. You can repeat treatment to maintain gains or treat additional joints.
